title: Even and odd numbers
content: The set ` ZZ ` of integers can be partitioned into the set of even numbers and the set of odd numbers, see ~ zeo4 . Instead of defining new class variables ` Even ` and ` Odd ` to represent these sets, we use the idiom ` 2 || N ` to say that "` N ` is _even_" (which implies ` N e. ZZ `, see ~ evenelz ) and ` -. 2 || N ` to say that "` N ` is _odd_" (under the assumption that ` N e. ZZ `). The previously proven theorems about even and odd numbers, like ~ zneo , ~ zeo , ~ zeo2 , etc. use different representations, which are equivalent to the representations using the divides relation, see ~ evend2 and ~ oddp1d2 . The corresponding theorems are ~ zeneo , ~ zeo3 and ~ zeo4 .

blocks.name: evenelz
blocks.content: An even number is an integer. This follows immediately from the reverse closure of the divides relation, see ~ dvdszrcl . (Contributed by AV, 22-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: zeo3
blocks.content: An integer is even or odd. With this representation of even and odd integers, this variant of ~ zeo follows immediately from the law of excluded middle, see ~ exmidd . (Contributed by AV, 17-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: zeo4
blocks.content: An integer is even or odd but not both. With this representation of even and odd integers, this variant of ~ zeo2 follows immediately from the principle of double negation, see ~ notnotb . (Contributed by AV, 17-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: zeneo
blocks.content: No even integer equals an odd integer (i.e. no integer can be both even and odd). Exercise 10(a) of [Apostol] p. 28. This variant of ~ zneo follows immediately from the fact that a contradiction implies anything, see ~ pm2.21i . (Contributed by AV, 22-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: odd2np1lem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ odd2np1 . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 3-Apr-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)

blocks.name: even2n
blocks.content: An integer is even iff it is twice another integer. (Contributed by AV, 25-Jun-2020.)

thm even2n(setvar s0, class c0) {

  mpbid(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wceq(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), c0)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), cz))
  adantr(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wceq(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), c0), wcel(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), cz))

  id(wcel(cv(s0), cz))

  eleq1(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), c0, cz)
  mpan(wcel(c0, cz), wb(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), c0))), wcel(nat2, cz))
  2z()
  syl6bb(wa(wcel(nat2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), c0)), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(cv(s0), cmul, nat2), c0)))
  divides(s0, nat2, c0)
  rexbiia(s0, cz, wceq(co(cv(s0), cmul, nat2), c0), wceq(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), c0))

blocks.name: mod2eq0even
blocks.content: An integer is 0 modulo 2 iff it is even (i.e. divisible by 2), see example 2 in [ApostolNT] p. 107. (Contributed by AV, 21-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: mod2eq1n2dvds
blocks.content: An integer is 1 modulo 2 iff it is odd (i.e. not divisible by 2), see example 3 in [ApostolNT] p. 107. (Contributed by AV, 24-May-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: 2teven
blocks.content: A number which is twice an integer is even. (Contributed by AV, 16-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: zeo5
blocks.content: An integer is either even or odd, version of ~ zeo3 avoiding the negation of the representation of an odd number. (Proposed by BJ, 21-Jun-2021.) (Contributed by AV, 26-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: evend2
blocks.content: An integer is even iff its quotient with 2 is an integer. This is a representation of even numbers without using the divides relation, see ~ zeo and ~ zeo2 . (Contributed by AV, 22-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: oddp1d2
blocks.content: An integer is odd iff its successor divided by 2 is an integer. This is a representation of odd numbers without using the divides relation, see ~ zeo and ~ zeo2 . (Contributed by AV, 22-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: zob

blocks.name: oddm1d2
blocks.content: An integer is odd iff its predecessor divided by 2 is an integer. This is another representation of odd numbers without using the divides relation. (Contributed by AV, 18-Jun-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: z0even

blocks.name: n2dvds1
blocks.content: 2 does not divide 1. That means 1 is odd. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.) (Proof shortened by Steven Nguyen, 3-May-2023.)

blocks.name: sumodd
blocks.content: If every term in a sum is odd, then the sum is even iff the number of terms in the sum is even. (Contributed by AV, 14-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: evensumodd
blocks.content: If every term in a sum with an even number of terms is odd, then the sum is even. (Contributed by AV, 14-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: oddsumodd
blocks.content: If every term in a sum with an odd number of terms is odd, then the sum is odd. (Contributed by AV, 14-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: pwp1fsum
blocks.content: The n-th power of a number increased by 1 expressed by a product with a finite sum. (Contributed by AV, 15-Aug-2021.)
